creator: madurina.seelam@cingular.com
text:
We have the log4j setup using DailyRollingfileAppender with option "'.' yyyy-
MM-dd".
The rolling happens properly in QA but in production, the previous days file 
just has data from midnight 12PM to 1:00AM.

questions are why is the previous days file having daya of today.
why did it erase the existing data and right this.

We are not to decide what causing this both 2 thing of interest are.
In production we have to managed server writing to this file.
the servers are restart at aroun 1:00AM.
any kind of help is greatly appreciated.

It looks like more than one JVM is writing to the same file, which is known to be an 
unsafe practice. As this is more of a Java issue than a log4j bug, I am closing this 
bug. If you want to continue this discussion please do so on log4j-dev@ mailing 
list. Thank you.
